title: Using u-substitution
speech: Let  u is equal to, 1 minus, x  so  d u is equal to negative 1 d x,  or  negative d u is equal to d x

title: Change the limits
text: After setting f(x) to f(u), you need to change the limits of integration because the variable of integration has changed from $$x$$ to u.
speech: After setting f(x) to f(u), you need to change the limits of integration because the variable of integration has changed from  x  to u.
pacedSpeech: After setting f(x) to f(u), you need to change the limits of integration because the variable of integration has changed from   x

title: New lower limit
text: What is the new lower limit in term of u?

subHints.title: New lower limit
subHints.text: Using $$u=1-x$$ in the first hint, we have $$u=1-(1)=0$$

speech: What is the new lower limit in term of u?

title: New upper limit
text: What is the new upper limit in term of u?

subHints.title: New upper limit
subHints.text: Using $$u=1-x$$ in the first hint, we have $$u=1-(2)=-1$$

speech: What is the new upper limit in term of u?
pacedSpeech: What is the new upper limit in term of u?

title: New integral expression
text: The new integral with a variable of u will be $$-\int e^u \,du$$ as the limit goes from $$u=0$$ to $$u=-1$$
speech: The new integral with a variable of u will be  minus, the integral of e to the u-th d u,  as the limit goes from  u is equal to 0  to  u, is equal to negative 1

as the limit goes from   u is equal to 0
to   u, is equal to negative 1

title: Find the integral
text: $$\int e^u \,du=e^u$$ as the limit goes from $$u=-1$$ to $$u=0$$. Note that the lower limit always has to be less than the upper limit. To change the order of limits, we multply the integral with $$-1$$.
speech: the integral of e to the u-th d u is equal to, e to the u-th  as the limit goes from  u, is equal to, negative 1  to  u, is equal to, 0 . Note that the lower limit always has to be less than the upper limit. To change the order of limits, we multply the integral with  negative 1 .

as the limit goes from   u, is equal to, negative 1
. Note that the lower limit always has to be less than the upper limit. To change the order of limits, we multply the integral with   negative 1

title: Evaluate the integral
speech: e to the 0 minus, e raised to the parentheses negative 1  power is equal to negative parentheses, e raised to the parentheses negative 1  power  plus 1
